channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+1441] Awesome... Cave and Well in Mexico's Yucatan (pic)
[+1276] Tea Partiers Admit They're Dumb In Final Health Care Protest
item.description: On March 16, Tea Partiers gathered (in disappointing numbers) in front of the Capitol building for their final protest against health care reform. Also in town, appropriately, was Barnum & Bailey’s circus. Averse to facts, no one interviewed could cite evidence for their false beliefs about the proposal and said they get their facts from Fox & Beck

item.title: [+1110] Everyone Has A Price .. Even a Chicken (Comic)
item.description: And that's how you do business.

item.title: [+992] You Dont Have To Be Naked To Have Fun (PIC)
[+911] Beautiful...powerful...feminine.. WHAT THE...!!!???
[+884] Could McDonald's Replace Beef Burgers With Seitan?
item.description: McDonald's could replace all its beef with beef-flavored seitan and NO ONE would notice the difference. McDonald's would save a fortune, health would be improved, and the carbon and resource footprint of McDonald's would be massively slashed.

item.title: [+873] George Clooney Voted Against Himself for Best Actor Award
item.description: The A-list actor didn't even vote for himself to win the best actor Oscar at this year's Academy Awards, as he checked off the name of fellow actor (and eventual winner) Jeff Bridges instead.

item.title: [+703] Acne drug prevents HIV breakout
item.description: Johns Hopkins scientists have found that a safe and inexpensive antibiotic in use since the 1970s for treating acne effectively targets infected immune cells in which HIV, the virus that causes AIDS, lies dormant and prevents them from reactivating and replicating.

item.title: [+666] India Wants To Ban Lindsay Lohan
item.description: The Indian government wants to ban her from ever setting foot in their nation again.

item.title: [+596] The Onion: Pope Forgives Molested Children
item.description: "We must send a clear message to these hundreds—perhaps thousands—of children whose sinful ways have tempted so many of the church's servants into lustful violation of their holy vows of celibacy. The church forgives them for their transgressions and looks upon them not with intolerance, but compassion."

item.title: [+588] Zombie Flow Chart
item.description: There is no such thing as safe harbor from Zombies. Over the years they’ve infiltrated peaceful towns, ominous mansions, space, and even Nazi Germany.

item.title: [+523] Michael Moore: Bart Stupak, Has Neither a Uterus nor a Brain
item.description: Hey, Bart. If you really want to reduce abortions, ask yourself this: Why does godless France, where abortion is nearly free (it's covered by their universal health insurance), have 20% fewer abortions per capita than we do?

item.title: [+516] Japanese Researchers Turn Mosquitoes Into Flying Vaccinators
item.description: A group of Japanese researchers has developed a mosquito that spreads vaccine instead of disease.

item.title: [+506] Boba Fett and Jennifer Aniston Star in a Romantic Comedy
item.description: A really funny faux movie poster for an upcoming Jennifer Aniston and Boba Fett romantic comedy. Probably a step up from George Lucas' last few films.

item.title: [+452] Learn To Fly Here! (PIC)
[+432] The Pacific and Adjacent Theaters in WWII [PICS]
item.description: The Pacific, produced by Tom Hanks & Steven Spielberg WWII has again come into the living rooms of American families. The Pacific will focus on the US Marines in the Pacific Theater of the war. This photo collection focuses on The Pacific War, a term referring to parts of World War II that took place in the Pacific Ocean, the islands of....

item.title: [+429] How Many Mexican Drug War Deaths Are Caused by U.S. Pot Laws
item.description: It was less than one year ago when acting U.S. DEA administrator Michelle Leonhart publicly declared that the escalating violence on the U.S./Mexico border should be viewed as a sign of the “success” of America’s drug war strategies.

item.title: [+421] Dr. Horrible 2 Will Be A Movie
item.description: "That's their plan," he reiterated when asked whether a feature-film was indeed the preferred format for the sequel. "I don't know of what scale. They're talking all options, because they made the first 'Dr. Horrible' in five days on no budget at all — that was its intention."

item.title: [+414] The B Button: A poem about Mario
